setup_server¶

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

ServerSetup

The base class that all cogs must inherit from.

Functions¶

setup(bot)

class setup_server.ServerSetup(bot)¶

Bases: discord.ext.commands.Cog

The base class that all cogs must inherit from.

A cog is a collection of commands, listeners, and optional state to help group commands together. More information on them can be found on the Cogs page.

When inheriting from this class, the options shown in CogMeta are equally valid here.

await cleanup(self)¶
await setup(self, ctx)¶

This commands setups some logging system for system for server with some nice features

await add(self, ctx, add_type, channel)¶

This command adds logging of the following things in the specified text channel > - ban > - warns > - unban > - feedback

If the data for the any of the above is already available in database then it rewrite the data.

Example usage:

)add ban #bans

Parameters

  • add_type (Literal[ban, feedback, warns, unban]) –

  • channel (discord.ext.commands.TextChannelConverter) –

await support(self, ctx, textchannel, support_required_role)¶

Creates a public support system in an interactive manner.

Parameters

  • textchannel (-) – A text channel where the support request will be logged.

  • support_required_role (-) – A role which will be provided to the users, when a support request lodged

await badlinks(self, ctx, action=None, logging_channel=None, option=True)¶

If enabled then it checks against any scam, phishing or adult links which is posted by members and take actions accordingly

Parameters

  • (default (- option [Optional]) – log) : What kind of action to take, It accepts the following options ; ‘ban’, ‘mute’, ‘timeout’, ‘kick’, ‘log’

  • [Optional] (- logging_channel) – It will log in a specific channel if specified, otherwise it will log the message where the link was sent.

  • (default – True) : It accepts the following options ; True, False, yes, no, on, off

  • action (Optional[Literal[ban, mute, timeout, kick, log]]) –

  • logging_channel (Optional[discord.ext.commands.TextChannelConverter]) –

  • option (Literal[yes, no, on, off, True, False]) –

Note: If ‘log’ action is selected then, I will only delete the message and log it the current channel where the link was sent and will do nothing

await starboard(self, ctx, channel, no_of_stars=5, self_star=False, ignore_nsfw=True)¶

Setups the starboard in your server. It posts the message in the specified channel whenever someone stars a message using ⭐ emoji

Parameters

  • channel (-) – The channel where the starred message will go

  • [int] (- no_of_stars [Optional]) – Minimum number of stars required before posting it to the specified channel

  • (default (- ignore_nsfw [Optional] [bool]) – False) : Whether self starring of message should be there or not

  • (default – True) : Whether to ignore NSFW channels or not

  • no_of_stars (Optional[int]) –

  • self_star (Optional[bool]) –

  • ignore_nsfw (Optional[bool]) –

await on_message(self, message)¶
await raw_data(self, ctx)¶

It returns the raw data which is stored in the database in the form of json

await on_guild_remove(self, guild)¶
await deletedata(self, ctx, type_data='all')¶

This command deletes the available data: It accepts an optional parameter type_data, You can pass the following things through type_data parameter:

  • ban : Deletes the ban data from database

  • unban : Deletes the unban data from database

  • support : Deletes the support data from database

  • warns : Deletes the warns data from database

  • feedback: Deletes the feedback data from database

  • mentionspam: Deletes the mentionspam data from database

  • antiraid: Deletes the antiraid data from database

  • badlinks: Deletes the badlinks data from database

  • starboard: Deletes the starboard data from database

By default the type_data is set to all, which will delete all the data present in the database.

Parameters

type_data (Literal[ban, unban, support, warns, feedback, mentionspam, antiraid, starboard, badlinks, all]) –
